headline: Jesse's mom tells him to stop yelling at Juan
subHeadline: Jesse Watters shares text messages from his mother in this week's edition of 'Mom Texts.'

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: Hey, I'm Greg Gutfeld with Jedediah Bila, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters, and a beanbag is her beanbag chair. The Five. Dana Perino. It's hard to run for president. Every day is a test on how far you'll bend for approval. It's a limbo bar for your character. No matter how low others go, you've got to go lower. Here's how the 2020 race is shaping up for the Dems.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She's doing it in a restaurant. Anyway, that is low. But first, here's Kamala Harris getting low about getting high.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Have you ever smoked?

utterances.speaker: SEN. KAMALA HARRIS, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: I have.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And I inhaled. I did inhale.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Was it in college?

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Listen, I think that it gives a lot of people joy and we need more joy.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What does Kamala Harris listen to? What were you listening to when you was high? What was on?

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Oh, my goodness. Oh, yeah, definitely Snoop, Tupac --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Tupac.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: -- for sure.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now, you could say she lied. She was in school before Snoop and Tupac made records. But when you're high it's possible she thought she was listening to them when it was really this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But Kamala was just playing character limbo, trying to convince the left that she was rolling doobies, not drug dealers. That's the pander of prosecutor pretending that she never prosecuted. When asked if he would seek a female V.P., Cory Booker pandered away.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: If you got the nomination, would you commit to choosing a woman as your vice presidential running mate?

utterances.speaker: SEN. CORY BOOKER, D-N.J.
utterances.sentences: I think it would be malpractice. I'm not to going to make specific commitments, but we clearly should have -- I believe there should be a woman president right now and it's very hard to get one, but we have such a great fields of leaders. I think that you will rarely see a Democratic ticket anymore without gender diversity, race diversity. I think it's something that we should have. So, I'm not going to box myself in, but should I become it you'll know I'll be looking to women first.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Looking to women first, a perfect gentleman doing the limbo. He knows a mansion open the door for a woman, figuratively, not literally. That would be sexist. And when Howard Schultz was asked about taxes, he said this.

utterances.speaker: HOWARD SCHLTZ, FORMER STARBUCKS CEO
utterances.sentences: But the headline is here, I should be paying more taxes and people who make this kind of revenue and of means should pay more taxes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Of course, rich people who say they want to pay more taxes are just rolling under the limbo poll. Here's a tip, Howie, write a check to the U.S. government, sign it and leave it blank. The IRS will do the rest. But the queen of pandering, Liz Warren, showing up at a Native American conference. She can't stop because she's a politician and politicians will do anything for approval, which is why this chap is so refreshing.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: How easy it is to be presidential, but you all would be out of here right now. You'll be so bored. We've got more money. We've got more brains. We've got better houses, apartments. We've got nicer boats. I went to better school. I went to better everything. I'm president and they're not. You love your dogs, don't you? I wouldn't mind having one, honestly, but I don't have any time. I don't have -- How would I look walking a dog on the White House lawn? Feels a little phony to me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's the opposite of pandering. While everyone else is buying a focus group breed of caulk a poodle, he says nope, not for me. I guess he likes his animals well done.  Dana, did you find that offensive -- we're talking about this yesterday, you find it offensive that he said he didn't like dogs or do you respect him for being honest?

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.sentences: Oh, I respect him for being honest. Like, when I would say, like, I'm not -- I like a cat --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- but I don't want to have a cat.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I hear you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No offense, Angie. At home with four of us rescue cats in Denver.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're not really rescuing cats.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It was easier before social media and before the 24/7 news cycle because you could go to an event in Iowa and say I love ethanol.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Ethanol is fantastic. And then you can go someplace else and say, oh, absolutely. I'm absolutely for more solar panels. You betcha, I am. And no one would ever know and that's how you could cobble together a coalition.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now it's impossible. Jesse, when you listen to Trump, does he pander enough?

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.sentences: I think he could pander more. I think we all know what we're talking about. Here's my imitation of Democrats, Greg. That was such a brilliant monologue, Greg. You know, I used to write monologues when I was in college, always thought about writing a book of all my monologues. Do you have that idea?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We're like monologue brothers. So that's what they do, OK. And this is why they do it. It's because they're participating in the pandering Olympics because what they do is their base is all filled up with specifics interest groups. You have the gays, the blacks, the Hispanics, the women.   And when they try to be everything to everybody, they spread themselves so thin there's no core there. So, Kamala, you're not hip-hop. Trump is more hip-hop than you are. Schultz, be a billionaire. You own it. You know, if you want to pay more taxes, you check the box.  Cory Booker should pick the most qualified V.P. candidate. When you're not doing that, you look unqualified. And Elizabeth Warren, stop apologizing to Native Americans, there's other population groups out there, soccer moms for instance. They should be your focus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wisconsin. Hey, you know, Juan, I'm going to say something nice about Kamala Harris. During that interview, she didn't talk about the medicinal qualities of marijuana. She mentioned joy which is the first time a politician I have seen in this stance admit that recreational use of marijuana is actually OK. Which I think is, like -- that's not pandering. That's actually a step forward.

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.sentences: Wow, she's got your vote.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, because nobody -- everybody hides behind medicinal. There's -- oh, I'm for decriminalization for medicinal effect --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You're going to need to smoke weed when she takes your health care away.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But I like the fact that she said, no, if it brings people joy. That's the real argument in my --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Why? It seems authentic to me, but I don't -- I mean, I'm trying to figure out -- because to me you're saying this is Democrats and I'm thinking to myself, I just went through 2016, right? Where I believe on Cinco de Mayo, Trump said best tacos. Didn't he say that? Didn't he say that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, but wasn't he trolling than pandering?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, he said this --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Ironic pandering.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ironic pandering.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Ironic. And then, of course, he goes to West Virginia, what's he do, he puts on a coalminer hat.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, what about talking to the Christian evangelicals? He says, oh, you know, I don't go to church but when I do, I don't ask for forgiveness. Then said, oh, wait a second. When I take my little bit of wine and my little bit of cracker.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Cracker.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Cracker? What is going on?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: See what I mean? He's terrible in pandering.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's what he's doing, Greg. He's pandering.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But he's doing it in a way that everybody knows he's pandering, transparent pandering.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Transponder.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know all these interest groups you're talking about, the blacks, you know, the Native Americans. They're Americans.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I know. And that's why I think the Democrats should speak with a unifying message instead of changing their message and their character for each group.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Trump just sticks with the white nationals.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Stop it, Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, please. Bring us down. This is a fun segment. Jedediah, I think -- I have a theory that anybody who doesn't fit into an acceptable frame can no longer run for president and then Trump changed that. He says it's OK to be a jerk and go out and say what you want.

utterances.speaker: JEDEDIAH BILA, HOST
utterances.sentences: He's also just being himself. He's not afraid to be himself. Love him or hate him, this is what he is. This is what he's like. This is probably how he talks to his family. This is how he talks to his friends. He's not putting it on for the camera. And I think the Democrats are just trying really hard to be like. I like that Kamala interview because that was the first time that I saw her just being herself. I believed her. I believe that she smoke a pot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Even though she might be lying about --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I thought you would defend her on that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, I am -- I don't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because -- I think that she thought she heard something else. Like, two people asking something at the same time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, exactly.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: I think at some point she probably was high and was listening to that, but it was a humanity that I saw in her. And I don't understand why they keep putting out this rehearsed nonsense. All of those politicians, Hillary Clinton that tries so hard to be light, they don't win. The people that actually win elections are the people that are real and authentic.  Joe Biden is an example on the left. I think Barack Obama to an extent, that's just who he was. Trump is an example. Just be yourself. And, you know, if you're grumpy or whatever that is, that's your thing, use it. People might actually like it. Whoever thought that Trump, doing what he does, would get him elected president?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: By the way, I'm just so confused. You know some days at The Five I get confused.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now you know how we feel when you talk.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You guys just said that Trump is a jerk but he's an authentic -- I'm thinking, wait, this guy is a pro-Trump.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: He's a non-P.C. New York guy. He ran a business --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, but why would you call him --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I'm saying in this day and age an honest person is seen as a jerk and that's too bad.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think that's not true. You're pretty honest. I don't think - - I think -- are we all jerks?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm a jerk.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know I'm a jerk. I embrace my inner jerk. All right, will he or won't he, what President Trump is saying about signing the border deal. That's next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Deal or no deal to avoid another government shutdown? President Trump not yet ready to say if he'll support a border security deal that includes $1.4 billion to build new barriers. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We haven't gotten it yet. We'll be getting it. We'll be looking for landmines because you could have that, you know. It's been known to happen before to people. But we have not gotten it yet. It will be sent to us at some point and we'll take a very serious look at it. I appreciate all the work the Republicans have done because they're really going against a radical left. I don't want to see a shutdown. A shutdown would be a terrible thing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So, Jedediah, no more mention so far of emergency declarations. It seems as if the Republicans in the Senate aren't buying it. But he's not clear. He's not -- he's kind of holding us in suspense. Is this like Trump the TV producer or what?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Maybe. I mean, I think he knows right now the numbers that have been released. The deal looks like it stinks, it really does. I mean, a lot of people on the right are going to be sitting there and saying what was all point of a shutdown? Because I think people thought you shutdown the government to try to budge the Democrats. And if they didn't budge, your next step was going to be declaring a national emergency. So I think now he's, unfortunately, in a position where he put out there in the very same way -- he has to learn to stop doing this. He put out there, you know, Mexico is going to pay for the wall, didn't work out that way. He put out there I'm not going to budge. I'm going to dig my heels in. And then when you don't, people are disappointed in you. So no matter what he does now -- now he's saying, oh, I'm going to redirect more other federal funds into this, so don't worry. You're still going to get the wall. We're still going to figure it out even if I have to do it by executive order.  But the thing is, this shutdown, this whole shutdown was completely absurd and a waste of time. If it wasn't going to force him to kind of say, you know what, my way or the highway because this is a national emergency. Either it's a national emergency or it's not. Make up your mind.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They should go on Howie's show, Deal or No Deal, and fund the wall that way. You know how the models hold the money in a box and then Trump could just pick one. Maybe that's a good way to do it. I honestly think he should take this deal and here's why. It funds 55 miles of border wall. He wanted 200 miles of border wall. This provides a border wall. Nancy wanted no wall, so he's already winning like that. Marc Thiessen had a great piece --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- in the Washington Post today.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I saw that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There's another huge leverage play that the president could do. The sequester comes into effect at the end of the year. This was signed by Barack Obama and the senate Democrats, Juan. So they cut spending by $130 billion if they don't lift this cap. So the president could just say, hey, you know what, give me my 5.7 or else I won't sign it. Do you think the Democrats are really going to throw away $130 billion of spending which they love to do, for a measly 5.7 billion? He's got them right where he wants them. Or do the El Chapo thing and then that's how you get Mexico to pay for it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's your opening.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, if he can't get Mexico to pay for it, he'll get a Mexican to pay for it. It still qualifies. Look, this is -- you know, I always go back to the reason why this is so contaminated. It's the media. The media is the mirror that the Democrats have to face every day, right? And the mirror laughs at you if you compromise. And if the media -- if the media disappeared for one week this problem would have been solved. A perfect example is when you watch like morning bozo. He will scream about how -- what an autocrat Trump is, right? He's terrible. He's unbinding tyrant. And then when Trump compromises, he just laughs at him and mocks him. And so the media knows if that they do any compromise they will be -- I mean, if the Democrats compromise the media will mock them. So there's actually no incentive for them to do it. If the media had disappeared from this, there would have been a compromise and they would have listened to engineers and the experts.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think it's right wing talk radio that's saying don't take this deal. We wanted a wall. You promise it's a wall.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: It's not just talk radio. It's a lot of people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm just saying -- he was saying like Morning Joe. But, anyway, to go on, Dana --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I said morning bozo.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't watch Morning Joe.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Dana, in fact, and this is something Jedediah was picking up on, we had a 35 day shutdown. He would have had more money and a better deal if he had taken what was offered in December --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- than if he's taken what was offered today.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right. Right. So that's why he probably should have done it. And he didn't give the Republicans indications he was not going to sign until the 11th hour, which is how you ended up with the shutdown in the first place. Once the shutdown ended and it look like the president was willing to compromise and he has been willing to, his numbers went up. The State of the Union was great, like he's on a roll. Like, to me, ride the wave, signed the deal, rise above the media. Like, he's the most powerful person in the world.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Beside from me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So tell all of them, like, yeah, this is the deal we got. I'm happy with it. Or maybe now -- I'm not happy. I'm taking the deal because it's the right thing to do. I'm going to continue to work on it. We know he's going to run on immigration and border issues for 2020, but stop pushing. I would say that his supporters, stop pushing him into fights that he can't win --

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- because then you're back in this thing trying to, like, say, well, it's not a good deal and he doesn't look like a good deal maker. It's not -- just like -- if you want to support him, just, like, let it go, right?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: The problem makes no sense now because he said, originally, that what they offered wasn't enough because there was this emergency. And then when he rejected the deal, he said -- he amped up the conversation about how there was this huge national emergency.  We're talking about caravans, all of which is true. Human trafficking, drug trafficking, all of that stuff, and now suddenly he's going to accept the deal at a lower value which makes all of that talk about the national emergency look like he wasn't serious.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There were some benefits, though --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But he might still do a national emergency.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We've got a lot of Democrats on the record saying really dumb things about walls and we can use that against them in the midterms. Also, support for the wall has gone up and Trump's numbers with Hispanics have really skyrocketed.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know what amazes me is that we're all talking about this which is -- it was a fake emergency. There was never an invasion.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: People died at the border. People died at the border, that wasn't fake.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, and the media reacts as if, oh, this is real.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You guys were screaming about humanitarian crisis, and so the government dealt with it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: This is so absurd, Greg. But it's a matter of -- and even today --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're denying -- you're denying that there was suffering.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Even today, the president saying we're building the wall. Well, if you're already building the wall what are you complaining -- he says we have contracts going -- I won't -- I hope he's OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, because six miles are already being built.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: It is an emergency --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Mitch McConnell putting Senate Democrats on record as to whether or not they support the green new deal. That's next right here. Here the fireworks on The Five.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Nickelback week, baby.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's put up or shut up time for green new deal supporters. Mitch McConnell saying the Senate will vote on the far-left pipe dream to try to get Democrats, especially 2020 hopefuls, on the record.

utterances.speaker: SEN. MITCH MCCONNELL, R-KY, SENATE MAJORITY LEADER
utterances.sentences: I've noted with great interest the green new deal. And we're going to be voting on that in the Senate. We'll give everybody an opportunity to go on record and see how they feel about the green new deal.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That was him smiling, if you guys couldn't tell. But one of the coauthors of the radical plan slamming the senate majority leader for trying to rush a vote. Senator Ed Markey getting mocked for accusing McConnell of trying to, quote, "sabotage," the movement he and his fellow Democrats are building. And Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez ramping up the rhetoric to defend the plan, the freshman congresswoman tweeting, don't mess with our future when it comes to climate, it's all our lives at stake. The younger you are the more consequences you'll see. It's life and death for us, and we will fight like it. Dana, conservatives sometimes used to really dislike Mitch McConnell. They thought he was establishment and he wasn't getting things done.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So irritating.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Mitch McConnell is really delivering when you think about the judges and then making these Democrats vote on the green new deal.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, he's a strategic thinker. He never wanted to run for president and that is something that people kind of forget. So he's a creature of the Senate. He loves the Senate, studied the Senate, wanted to be a part of it, and he doesn't have aspirations beyond that. He wants to do the best that he can. And it is interesting to me that last week when Marquis and Ocasio-Cortez introduced their resolution to great fanfare. You know on other cable stations there was a bug, which is a little thing down the bottom that said count down to the green new deal press conference.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They got a lot of press on it. All these 2020 Democrats signed on right away. They tweeted about -- to me, they're already on record supporting the green new deal. So this vote is just formalizing that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So if these 2020 hopefuls, Greg, are on the record saying they support abolishing air travel or giving free income for those unwilling to work, what does it do to them?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, the vote is great because it gets -- you know, it exposes them as the most impractical children alive, that they're actually voting for a rainbow made of marshmallows. By the way, Mitch needs a nickname. He should be called Satan's turtle because he looks so benign.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What about cocaine Mitch?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Cocaine Mitch. But cocaine Mitch is like they don't get it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Satan's turtle. Make it stick, America. But this plan is a typical progressive disaster and that it's only half a thing, and it's the easy half which is the wish list. But the other half is missing which is how do you achieve this? And that leads to the ultimate problem which is centralized, massive bureaucracy and that leads to coercion because in order to make something - - the big dream that fails, in order to make it survive, you need coercion and force. That means you need an army to punish the individual. And that means fascism and then, ultimately, all of our deaths.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That was my AOC impression.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, some of these 2020 hopefuls on the Democratic side not too keen on the green new deal. Let's listen in. You can react.

utterances.speaker: HOWARD SCHULTZ, FORMER STARBUCKS CEO
utterances.sentences: Let's be sensible about what we're suggesting. Let's not just throw stuff against the wall because it's a good slogan or we get a press release. Let's be truthful.

utterances.speaker: SEN. AMY KLOBUCHAR, D-MINN.
utterances.sentences: The green new deal, I see it as -- by the way, I see it as aspirational. I see it as a jump start. So I would vote yes, but I would also if it got down to the nitty-gritty of an actual legislation as opposed to, oh, here are some goals we have, that would be different for me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So some division amongst the ranks.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Frist, before I begin say I'm just so pleased and proud of you for finally understanding that Mitch McConnell is a conservative. I know you've been going after --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Me?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That was the other guy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You and the other -- you and the rest of the far-right that was --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That was years ago.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, it wasn't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Years ago --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It wasn't even during the campaign, they were going after Mitch McConnell, but it's all right. Here's the thing, McConnell is just staging and you could see it in the smile you described, it's a stunt. It's a stunt vote intended -- and from his perspective to embarrass Democrats.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

They shouldn't be defensive. If this is what they stand for, if this is what they want to do, if this is what they feel, you don't just put out a plan - you know I love that line, it's aspirational, I don't have time for that. I'm looking for facts, I'm looking for something. If you're really interested in limiting carbon emissions and that's your plan, people like Mike Bloomberg, people who are serious about that are looking at this and saying, this isn't about The Wonderful Wizard of Oz and all the things that maybe you could do if you had enough money. You're talking about tens upon tens of trillions of dollars. You're going to put out this and claim to be a serious politician, be able to stand by it, be able to explain it, be able to go vote for it, and be able to tell people, how you going to pay for this stuff?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Can I have one thing?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.sentences: Yes, that's not going to be a really good idea.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They are probably way ahead of me.

utterances.sentences: All right, radical Congresswoman Omar causing even more controversy today. We'll show you what she did next.

utterances.sentences: I fail to understand why members of this Committee or the American people should find any testimony that you give today to be truthful.

utterances.sentences: If I can respond to that--

utterances.speaker: OMAR
utterances.sentences: I am - it wasn't a question.

utterances.sentences: I think it is an attack--

utterances.speaker: OMAR
utterances.sentences: That was not - that was not a question. That was - I reserve the right to my time--

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Jesse, I - this issue of her deflecting and turning to Trump, I think it's pretty outrageous actually, because this is not one incident. This is a series of horrific tweets that she's had in her history. This is what you know - this horrific nonsense that she did to the Covington boys. There's so many instances you can bring up of her, either saying something bigoted and having to apologize or doing something that's very questionable, like that - so what do you think about this?

And this is from the result, most of us came out of that conversation very troubled by the answers we received and not convinced where her heart is on these things. She hasn't changed, she hasn't listened, and she hasn't deleted any of these offensive tweets.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: That's the problem one, it's a pattern of behavior, and she hasn't been stripped of any Committee assignments. There seems to be no real consequence. In fact, Democrats and many in media are defending her. How many times does it take before somebody says, hold on there's a pattern here?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Do you want us go into patterns, how about Steve King, have you heard anything from President--

utterances.sentences: Steve King was stripped of his main assignments.

utterances.sentences: He was stripped of everything, wasn't he?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, no, no, that's not President Trump. President Trump has not said one word, never, not a word.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: But this isn't about President Trump, I'm talking about holding her accountable for her behavior.

utterances.speaker: WILLAIMS
utterances.sentences: But it is about President Trump, because he's saying she should resign, Jedediah. So, to my mind, what's going on is here people are saying, you know what you're not allowed to change the status quo, you're not allowed to start a conversation about what is US policy with regard to Israel and the Palestinians. US policy used to be we believe in a two-state solution. Trump and that yahoo (ph) come along, they knock it over and yet they don't have anything to substitute. Somebody comes in, who has experience in this area, because guess what, she's a Muslim woman and she says, hey you know what there's some reason to have concerns about Israeli policy, settlements, West Bank, and the like. But guess what, everybody else says, no don't talk about--

utterances.sentences: No, because she said Israel was evil.

utterances.sentences: She said they were evil. That was what the controversy was.

utterances.sentences: No, the controversy--

utterances.sentences: Yes, it was, Juan.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: But that doesn't once again - Dana that doesn't exist in isolation. That wasn't one comment she made, and now you have people on other networks saying, well you can't - suggesting you can't accuse her of any kind of bigotry, because she's a woman and because she's a minority.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.sentences: That's really troubling.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Maybe she's just old fashioned, she doesn't want to be lonely.

utterances.sentences: Yes, you know what, it's not going to help his street cred in getting dates, all right?

utterances.sentences: They are liars.

utterances.sentences: Okay, that's fake news maybe.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.utterance: Hey, I'm Greg Gutfeld with Jedediah Bila, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters, and a beanbag is her beanbag chair. The Five. Dana Perino. It's hard to run for president. Every day is a test on how far you'll bend for approval. It's a limbo bar for your character. No matter how low others go, you've got to go lower. Here's how the 2020 race is shaping up for the Dems.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She's doing it in a restaurant. Anyway, that is low. But first, here's Kamala Harris getting low about getting high.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Have you ever smoked?

utterances.speaker: SEN. KAMALA HARRIS, D-CALIF.
utterances.utterance: I have.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: And I inhaled. I did inhale.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Was it in college?

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: Listen, I think that it gives a lot of people joy and we need more joy.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: What does Kamala Harris listen to? What were you listening to when you was high? What was on?

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my goodness. Oh, yeah, definitely Snoop, Tupac --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Tupac.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: -- for sure.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Now, you could say she lied. She was in school before Snoop and Tupac made records. But when you're high it's possible she thought she was listening to them when it was really this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But Kamala was just playing character limbo, trying to convince the left that she was rolling doobies, not drug dealers. That's the pander of prosecutor pretending that she never prosecuted. When asked if he would seek a female V.P., Cory Booker pandered away.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: If you got the nomination, would you commit to choosing a woman as your vice presidential running mate?

utterances.speaker: SEN. CORY BOOKER, D-N.J.
utterances.utterance: I think it would be malpractice. I'm not to going to make specific commitments, but we clearly should have -- I believe there should be a woman president right now and it's very hard to get one, but we have such a great fields of leaders. I think that you will rarely see a Democratic ticket anymore without gender diversity, race diversity. I think it's something that we should have. So, I'm not going to box myself in, but should I become it you'll know I'll be looking to women first.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Looking to women first, a perfect gentleman doing the limbo. He knows a mansion open the door for a woman, figuratively, not literally. That would be sexist. And when Howard Schultz was asked about taxes, he said this.

utterances.speaker: HOWARD SCHLTZ, FORMER STARBUCKS CEO
utterances.utterance: But the headline is here, I should be paying more taxes and people who make this kind of revenue and of means should pay more taxes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Of course, rich people who say they want to pay more taxes are just rolling under the limbo poll. Here's a tip, Howie, write a check to the U.S. government, sign it and leave it blank. The IRS will do the rest. But the queen of pandering, Liz Warren, showing up at a Native American conference. She can't stop because she's a politician and politicians will do anything for approval, which is why this chap is so refreshing.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.utterance: How easy it is to be presidential, but you all would be out of here right now. You'll be so bored. We've got more money. We've got more brains. We've got better houses, apartments. We've got nicer boats. I went to better school. I went to better everything. I'm president and they're not. You love your dogs, don't you? I wouldn't mind having one, honestly, but I don't have any time. I don't have -- How would I look walking a dog on the White House lawn? Feels a little phony to me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's the opposite of pandering. While everyone else is buying a focus group breed of caulk a poodle, he says nope, not for me. I guess he likes his animals well done. Dana, did you find that offensive -- we're talking about this yesterday, you find it offensive that he said he didn't like dogs or do you respect him for being honest?

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.utterance: Oh, I respect him for being honest. Like, when I would say, like, I'm not -- I like a cat --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- but I don't want to have a cat.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I hear you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No offense, Angie. At home with four of us rescue cats in Denver.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're not really rescuing cats.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It was easier before social media and before the 24/7 news cycle because you could go to an event in Iowa and say I love ethanol.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Ethanol is fantastic. And then you can go someplace else and say, oh, absolutely. I'm absolutely for more solar panels. You betcha, I am. And no one would ever know and that's how you could cobble together a coalition.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Now it's impossible. Jesse, when you listen to Trump, does he pander enough?

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.utterance: I think he could pander more. I think we all know what we're talking about. Here's my imitation of Democrats, Greg. That was such a brilliant monologue, Greg. You know, I used to write monologues when I was in college, always thought about writing a book of all my monologues. Do you have that idea?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We're like monologue brothers. So that's what they do, OK. And this is why they do it. It's because they're participating in the pandering Olympics because what they do is their base is all filled up with specifics interest groups. You have the gays, the blacks, the Hispanics, the women. And when they try to be everything to everybody, they spread themselves so thin there's no core there. So, Kamala, you're not hip-hop. Trump is more hip-hop than you are. Schultz, be a billionaire. You own it. You know, if you want to pay more taxes, you check the box. Cory Booker should pick the most qualified V.P. candidate. When you're not doing that, you look unqualified. And Elizabeth Warren, stop apologizing to Native Americans, there's other population groups out there, soccer moms for instance. They should be your focus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wisconsin. Hey, you know, Juan, I'm going to say something nice about Kamala Harris. During that interview, she didn't talk about the medicinal qualities of marijuana. She mentioned joy which is the first time a politician I have seen in this stance admit that recreational use of marijuana is actually OK. Which I think is, like -- that's not pandering. That's actually a step forward.

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.utterance: Wow, she's got your vote.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, because nobody -- everybody hides behind medicinal. There's -- oh, I'm for decriminalization for medicinal effect --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're going to need to smoke weed when she takes your health care away.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But I like the fact that she said, no, if it brings people joy. That's the real argument in my --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Why? It seems authentic to me, but I don't -- I mean, I'm trying to figure out -- because to me you're saying this is Democrats and I'm thinking to myself, I just went through 2016, right? Where I believe on Cinco de Mayo, Trump said best tacos. Didn't he say that? Didn't he say that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, but wasn't he trolling than pandering?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, he said this --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Ironic pandering.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Ironic pandering.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Ironic. And then, of course, he goes to West Virginia, what's he do, he puts on a coalminer hat.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, what about talking to the Christian evangelicals? He says, oh, you know, I don't go to church but when I do, I don't ask for forgiveness. Then said, oh, wait a second. When I take my little bit of wine and my little bit of cracker.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Cracker.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Cracker? What is going on?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: See what I mean? He's terrible in pandering.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's what he's doing, Greg. He's pandering.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But he's doing it in a way that everybody knows he's pandering, transparent pandering.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Transponder.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know all these interest groups you're talking about, the blacks, you know, the Native Americans. They're Americans.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I know. And that's why I think the Democrats should speak with a unifying message instead of changing their message and their character for each group.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Trump just sticks with the white nationals.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Stop it, Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, please. Bring us down. This is a fun segment. Jedediah, I think -- I have a theory that anybody who doesn't fit into an acceptable frame can no longer run for president and then Trump changed that. He says it's OK to be a jerk and go out and say what you want.

utterances.speaker: JEDEDIAH BILA, HOST
utterances.utterance: He's also just being himself. He's not afraid to be himself. Love him or hate him, this is what he is. This is what he's like. This is probably how he talks to his family. This is how he talks to his friends. He's not putting it on for the camera. And I think the Democrats are just trying really hard to be like. I like that Kamala interview because that was the first time that I saw her just being herself. I believed her. I believe that she smoke a pot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Even though she might be lying about --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I thought you would defend her on that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, I am -- I don't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Because -- I think that she thought she heard something else. Like, two people asking something at the same time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, exactly.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: I think at some point she probably was high and was listening to that, but it was a humanity that I saw in her. And I don't understand why they keep putting out this rehearsed nonsense. All of those politicians, Hillary Clinton that tries so hard to be light, they don't win. The people that actually win elections are the people that are real and authentic. Joe Biden is an example on the left. I think Barack Obama to an extent, that's just who he was. Trump is an example. Just be yourself. And, you know, if you're grumpy or whatever that is, that's your thing, use it. People might actually like it. Whoever thought that Trump, doing what he does, would get him elected president?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: By the way, I'm just so confused. You know some days at The Five I get confused.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Now you know how we feel when you talk.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You guys just said that Trump is a jerk but he's an authentic -- I'm thinking, wait, this guy is a pro-Trump.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: He's a non-P.C. New York guy. He ran a business --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, but why would you call him --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I'm saying in this day and age an honest person is seen as a jerk and that's too bad.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think that's not true. You're pretty honest. I don't think - - I think -- are we all jerks?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm a jerk.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know I'm a jerk. I embrace my inner jerk. All right, will he or won't he, what President Trump is saying about signing the border deal. That's next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Deal or no deal to avoid another government shutdown? President Trump not yet ready to say if he'll support a border security deal that includes $1.4 billion to build new barriers. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: We haven't gotten it yet. We'll be getting it. We'll be looking for landmines because you could have that, you know. It's been known to happen before to people. But we have not gotten it yet. It will be sent to us at some point and we'll take a very serious look at it. I appreciate all the work the Republicans have done because they're really going against a radical left. I don't want to see a shutdown. A shutdown would be a terrible thing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, Jedediah, no more mention so far of emergency declarations. It seems as if the Republicans in the Senate aren't buying it. But he's not clear. He's not -- he's kind of holding us in suspense. Is this like Trump the TV producer or what?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Maybe. I mean, I think he knows right now the numbers that have been released. The deal looks like it stinks, it really does. I mean, a lot of people on the right are going to be sitting there and saying what was all point of a shutdown? Because I think people thought you shutdown the government to try to budge the Democrats. And if they didn't budge, your next step was going to be declaring a national emergency. So I think now he's, unfortunately, in a position where he put out there in the very same way -- he has to learn to stop doing this. He put out there, you know, Mexico is going to pay for the wall, didn't work out that way. He put out there I'm not going to budge. I'm going to dig my heels in. And then when you don't, people are disappointed in you. So no matter what he does now -- now he's saying, oh, I'm going to redirect more other federal funds into this, so don't worry. You're still going to get the wall. We're still going to figure it out even if I have to do it by executive order. But the thing is, this shutdown, this whole shutdown was completely absurd and a waste of time. If it wasn't going to force him to kind of say, you know what, my way or the highway because this is a national emergency. Either it's a national emergency or it's not. Make up your mind.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They should go on Howie's show, Deal or No Deal, and fund the wall that way. You know how the models hold the money in a box and then Trump could just pick one. Maybe that's a good way to do it. I honestly think he should take this deal and here's why. It funds 55 miles of border wall. He wanted 200 miles of border wall. This provides a border wall. Nancy wanted no wall, so he's already winning like that. Marc Thiessen had a great piece --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- in the Washington Post today.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I saw that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There's another huge leverage play that the president could do. The sequester comes into effect at the end of the year. This was signed by Barack Obama and the senate Democrats, Juan. So they cut spending by $130 billion if they don't lift this cap. So the president could just say, hey, you know what, give me my 5.7 or else I won't sign it. Do you think the Democrats are really going to throw away $130 billion of spending which they love to do, for a measly 5.7 billion? He's got them right where he wants them. Or do the El Chapo thing and then that's how you get Mexico to pay for it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's your opening.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, if he can't get Mexico to pay for it, he'll get a Mexican to pay for it. It still qualifies. Look, this is -- you know, I always go back to the reason why this is so contaminated. It's the media. The media is the mirror that the Democrats have to face every day, right? And the mirror laughs at you if you compromise. And if the media -- if the media disappeared for one week this problem would have been solved. A perfect example is when you watch like morning bozo. He will scream about how -- what an autocrat Trump is, right? He's terrible. He's unbinding tyrant. And then when Trump compromises, he just laughs at him and mocks him. And so the media knows if that they do any compromise they will be -- I mean, if the Democrats compromise the media will mock them. So there's actually no incentive for them to do it. If the media had disappeared from this, there would have been a compromise and they would have listened to engineers and the experts.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think it's right wing talk radio that's saying don't take this deal. We wanted a wall. You promise it's a wall.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: It's not just talk radio. It's a lot of people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm just saying -- he was saying like Morning Joe. But, anyway, to go on, Dana --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I said morning bozo.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't watch Morning Joe.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Dana, in fact, and this is something Jedediah was picking up on, we had a 35 day shutdown. He would have had more money and a better deal if he had taken what was offered in December --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- than if he's taken what was offered today.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right. Right. So that's why he probably should have done it. And he didn't give the Republicans indications he was not going to sign until the 11th hour, which is how you ended up with the shutdown in the first place. Once the shutdown ended and it look like the president was willing to compromise and he has been willing to, his numbers went up. The State of the Union was great, like he's on a roll. Like, to me, ride the wave, signed the deal, rise above the media. Like, he's the most powerful person in the world.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Beside from me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So tell all of them, like, yeah, this is the deal we got. I'm happy with it. Or maybe now -- I'm not happy. I'm taking the deal because it's the right thing to do. I'm going to continue to work on it. We know he's going to run on immigration and border issues for 2020, but stop pushing. I would say that his supporters, stop pushing him into fights that he can't win --

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- because then you're back in this thing trying to, like, say, well, it's not a good deal and he doesn't look like a good deal maker. It's not -- just like -- if you want to support him, just, like, let it go, right?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: The problem makes no sense now because he said, originally, that what they offered wasn't enough because there was this emergency. And then when he rejected the deal, he said -- he amped up the conversation about how there was this huge national emergency. We're talking about caravans, all of which is true. Human trafficking, drug trafficking, all of that stuff, and now suddenly he's going to accept the deal at a lower value which makes all of that talk about the national emergency look like he wasn't serious.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There were some benefits, though --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But he might still do a national emergency.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We've got a lot of Democrats on the record saying really dumb things about walls and we can use that against them in the midterms. Also, support for the wall has gone up and Trump's numbers with Hispanics have really skyrocketed.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what amazes me is that we're all talking about this which is -- it was a fake emergency. There was never an invasion.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: People died at the border. People died at the border, that wasn't fake.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, and the media reacts as if, oh, this is real.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You guys were screaming about humanitarian crisis, and so the government dealt with it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: This is so absurd, Greg. But it's a matter of -- and even today --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're denying -- you're denying that there was suffering.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Even today, the president saying we're building the wall. Well, if you're already building the wall what are you complaining -- he says we have contracts going -- I won't -- I hope he's OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, because six miles are already being built.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: It is an emergency --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Mitch McConnell putting Senate Democrats on record as to whether or not they support the green new deal. That's next right here. Here the fireworks on The Five.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Nickelback week, baby.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's put up or shut up time for green new deal supporters. Mitch McConnell saying the Senate will vote on the far-left pipe dream to try to get Democrats, especially 2020 hopefuls, on the record.

utterances.speaker: SEN. MITCH MCCONNELL, R-KY, SENATE MAJORITY LEADER
utterances.utterance: I've noted with great interest the green new deal. And we're going to be voting on that in the Senate. We'll give everybody an opportunity to go on record and see how they feel about the green new deal.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That was him smiling, if you guys couldn't tell. But one of the coauthors of the radical plan slamming the senate majority leader for trying to rush a vote. Senator Ed Markey getting mocked for accusing McConnell of trying to, quote, "sabotage," the movement he and his fellow Democrats are building. And Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez ramping up the rhetoric to defend the plan, the freshman congresswoman tweeting, don't mess with our future when it comes to climate, it's all our lives at stake. The younger you are the more consequences you'll see. It's life and death for us, and we will fight like it. Dana, conservatives sometimes used to really dislike Mitch McConnell. They thought he was establishment and he wasn't getting things done.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So irritating.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Mitch McConnell is really delivering when you think about the judges and then making these Democrats vote on the green new deal.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, he's a strategic thinker. He never wanted to run for president and that is something that people kind of forget. So he's a creature of the Senate. He loves the Senate, studied the Senate, wanted to be a part of it, and he doesn't have aspirations beyond that. He wants to do the best that he can. And it is interesting to me that last week when Marquis and Ocasio-Cortez introduced their resolution to great fanfare. You know on other cable stations there was a bug, which is a little thing down the bottom that said count down to the green new deal press conference.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They got a lot of press on it. All these 2020 Democrats signed on right away. They tweeted about -- to me, they're already on record supporting the green new deal. So this vote is just formalizing that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So if these 2020 hopefuls, Greg, are on the record saying they support abolishing air travel or giving free income for those unwilling to work, what does it do to them?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, the vote is great because it gets -- you know, it exposes them as the most impractical children alive, that they're actually voting for a rainbow made of marshmallows. By the way, Mitch needs a nickname. He should be called Satan's turtle because he looks so benign.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What about cocaine Mitch?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Cocaine Mitch. But cocaine Mitch is like they don't get it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Satan's turtle. Make it stick, America. But this plan is a typical progressive disaster and that it's only half a thing, and it's the easy half which is the wish list. But the other half is missing which is how do you achieve this? And that leads to the ultimate problem which is centralized, massive bureaucracy and that leads to coercion because in order to make something - - the big dream that fails, in order to make it survive, you need coercion and force. That means you need an army to punish the individual. And that means fascism and then, ultimately, all of our deaths.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was my AOC impression.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, some of these 2020 hopefuls on the Democratic side not too keen on the green new deal. Let's listen in. You can react.

utterances.speaker: HOWARD SCHULTZ, FORMER STARBUCKS CEO
utterances.utterance: Let's be sensible about what we're suggesting. Let's not just throw stuff against the wall because it's a good slogan or we get a press release. Let's be truthful.

utterances.speaker: SEN. AMY KLOBUCHAR, D-MINN.
utterances.utterance: The green new deal, I see it as -- by the way, I see it as aspirational. I see it as a jump start. So I would vote yes, but I would also if it got down to the nitty-gritty of an actual legislation as opposed to, oh, here are some goals we have, that would be different for me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So some division amongst the ranks.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Frist, before I begin say I'm just so pleased and proud of you for finally understanding that Mitch McConnell is a conservative. I know you've been going after --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Me?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was the other guy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You and the other -- you and the rest of the far-right that was --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That was years ago.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, it wasn't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Years ago --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It wasn't even during the campaign, they were going after Mitch McConnell, but it's all right. Here's the thing, McConnell is just staging and you could see it in the smile you described, it's a stunt. It's a stunt vote intended -- and from his perspective to embarrass Democrats.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But the reality is what Klobuchar --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Are they embarrassed?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- said this is an aspirational resolution. It's not a piece of legislation. And guess what, people sign onto the idea that, oh, the Republicans have not had any discussion about climate change, apparently, locked into the oil companies. They've refused --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Evil oil.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- anything to do with climate change. The rest of the country says what's going on, and they want to hear about it. That's why you have Democrats saying this is an important step and we want to get onboard. The specifics, you are right, they are not there, but look at this, today we learned the debt in this country now trillions under President Trump. Remember he said it was good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right. So let's raise it trillions on Green New Deal.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, no, remember you said, oh yes, we are going to do away with that, no more debts. That was Obama.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, you want to triple it with Green New Deal.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, I'm just saying that's the kind of talk that people tolerated on your side, Jesse, but they don't want to tolerate it coming from Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You may think it's incompetence.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: --it's a stunt, but the stunt's going to work, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh please.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: I can't imagine why you'd be embarrassed to support refurbishing every building in the United States in ten years, free jobs, free higher education, guarantees of everything. Look, if you're going to - stop being so defensive Democrats. If you like these ideas, great go out when people interview you and ask you and say, hey so you want to eliminate all air travel in ten years, be willing to stand by that. They shouldn't be defensive. If this is what they stand for, if this is what they want to do, if this is what they feel, you don't just put out a plan - you know I love that line, it's aspirational, I don't have time for that. I'm looking for facts, I'm looking for something. If you're really interested in limiting carbon emissions and that's your plan, people like Mike Bloomberg, people who are serious about that are looking at this and saying, this isn't about The Wonderful Wizard of Oz and all the things that maybe you could do if you had enough money. You're talking about tens upon tens of trillions of dollars. You're going to put out this and claim to be a serious politician, be able to stand by it, be able to explain it, be able to go vote for it, and be able to tell people, how you going to pay for this stuff?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Can I have one thing?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You know what Schumer should do?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: As a counter-stunt?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Tell the Democrats to vote no. Tell them all, this is the stunt, everybody vote no and that way, they don't have to worry about it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, that's what happened in the House. When the house last year tried to do something like this on ICE, and what the progressives said is just--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Dana, I don't like when you give advice to Democrats, okay?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's not going to be a really good idea.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They are probably way ahead of me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, radical Congresswoman Omar causing even more controversy today. We'll show you what she did next.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Democratic Congresswoman Ilhan Omar trying to deflect the controversy over her anti-Semitic remarks by attacking President Trump for saying she should resign. Omar tweeting, "You have trafficked in hate your whole life - against Jews, Muslims, Indigenous, immigrants, black people and more. I learned from people impacted by my words. When will you?" Then today, Omar found herself to be the subject of even more headlines, when she upended a hearing with the newly appointed Special Envoy to Venezuela Elliott Abrams to attack him personally over his involvement in the Iran-Contra scandal.

utterances.speaker: REP. ILHAN OMAR, D-MINN.
utterances.utterance: I fail to understand why members of this Committee or the American people should find any testimony that you give today to be truthful.

utterances.speaker: ELLIOTT ABRAMS, SPECIAL ENVOY TO VENEZUELA
utterances.utterance: If I can respond to that--

utterances.speaker: OMAR
utterances.utterance: I am - it wasn't a question.

utterances.speaker: ABRAMS
utterances.utterance: I think it is an attack--

utterances.speaker: OMAR
utterances.utterance: That was not - that was not a question. That was - I reserve the right to my time--

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Jesse, I - this issue of her deflecting and turning to Trump, I think it's pretty outrageous actually, because this is not one incident. This is a series of horrific tweets that she's had in her history. This is what you know - this horrific nonsense that she did to the Covington boys. There's so many instances you can bring up of her, either saying something bigoted and having to apologize or doing something that's very questionable, like that - so what do you think about this?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, she's a hostile child, she's not that smart. She actually called Mr. Abrams, Mr. Adams, when she introduced him. There was an anti- Semitic intervention in Minnesota, in her district. They had Jewish leaders before she even came to Congress so troubled by her language and her tweets, they staged a two-hour intervention at someone's home, because they thought listen - and this is from the report, she spent from age 8 to 12 in a Kenyan camp for Somali refugees. Maybe she didn't know about the Holocaust, they thought. They tried to educate her on tropes and dog whistles and code words. And this is from the result, most of us came out of that conversation very troubled by the answers we received and not convinced where her heart is on these things. She hasn't changed, she hasn't listened, and she hasn't deleted any of these offensive tweets.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: That's the problem one, it's a pattern of behavior, and she hasn't been stripped of any Committee assignments. There seems to be no real consequence. In fact, Democrats and many in media are defending her. How many times does it take before somebody says, hold on there's a pattern here?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Do you want us go into patterns, how about Steve King, have you heard anything from President--

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Steve King was stripped of his main assignments.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He was stripped of everything, wasn't he?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, no, that's not President Trump. President Trump has not said one word, never, not a word.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: But this isn't about President Trump, I'm talking about holding her accountable for her behavior.

utterances.speaker: WILLAIMS
utterances.utterance: But it is about President Trump, because he's saying she should resign, Jedediah. He's telling her to resign and you're blaming her for responding to the President calling her out. The idea to me is this, she said something that was offensive, she played on a trope to my mind that is absolutely degrading to Jewish people, and I think it contributes to the whole rise in anti-Semitism around the globe. And so she - what did she do, she said she apologized. So, to my mind, what's going on is here people are saying, you know what you're not allowed to change the status quo, you're not allowed to start a conversation about what is US policy with regard to Israel and the Palestinians. US policy used to be we believe in a two-state solution. Trump and that yahoo (ph) come along, they knock it over and yet they don't have anything to substitute. Somebody comes in, who has experience in this area, because guess what, she's a Muslim woman and she says, hey you know what there's some reason to have concerns about Israeli policy, settlements, West Bank, and the like. But guess what, everybody else says, no don't talk about--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, because she said Israel was evil.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She said they were evil. That was what the controversy was.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, the controversy--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, it was, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: --is that she said to them, you know what, we have a situation here where I feel that people are lobbying American politicians unfairly, and she was wrong because guess what, American politicians are lobbied all the time. That's part of our system.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: But that doesn't once again - Dana that doesn't exist in isolation. That wasn't one comment she made, and now you have people on other networks saying, well you can't - suggesting you can't accuse her of any kind of bigotry, because she's a woman and because she's a minority.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But you also have - a network of the CNN has their political reporter, Manu Raju, who caught up with her in the hallway to ask her about this, and she was incredibly rude to him. One of the books she might want to pick up along the way is How to Win Friends and Influence People, because it actually works. I would like to defend Elliott Abrams. This is a guy who is a total gentleman, a patriot, a public servant, who is willing to go back into government to try to help - free people from socialism. He doesn't need this job, and he's willing to go over there and answer her questions. But he would also like to answer the attacks on his character. And he could have very easily said something like, is there a reason you're treating me like this? Should we talk about that reason, what's the reason that you're treating me like this?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But he didn't do it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Don't forget about the gum chewing. Do you have anything to say about that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I saw that and I would recommend breath mint over the gum.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Gotcha.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: That's the thing too though about her apology. Many were saying that wasn't an apology, it's the way she approaches these things that there's a sense of defiance, that even when she is apologizing, it A, doesn't seem sincere, and if B, seems like she finds a way to then twist it and say, yes but but but and sort of defend herself in the same breath.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I accepted her apology, but I do think she doesn't like Jews. I do think she does and I think that, going after Trump about bigotry is interesting, he has a Jewish son and grandkids. He's from the - probably the best friend to Israel. He was I'm sure for gay marriage, before she was, well before she was. And I'm not sure what she's for when it comes to gay rights, when she supports certain kinds of organizations that are homophobic and misogynistic. I mean she is sympathetic to ISIS. Well, let's not forget, we talked about that and also other extremist organizations. She is defending Venezuela's misery. I mean she - I hope she doesn't change, because I think sunlight is the best disinfectant. I hope she continues to represent her honest radical self, because it's good to see that. I want to see exactly what she's like, and she benefits from - the media's disgusting, because they're playing intersectional math, woman Muslim minority Leftist, total force field. Total force field, so she get - this is what - this is why we have her now, she got away with it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: --how about the voters of Minnesota elected her.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BILA

utterances.utterance: I have no idea. Well maybe some did, maybe some did because of - because--

utterances.utterance: But then you open the door to people saying, and I think it's unfair to you, but people saying, oh so you're going after Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, you're going after Ilhan Omar, you're going after the lady from Michigan.

Let's say you love your wife or your husband, and you want it - do you want to put like more--

utterances.utterance: Is that what this is?

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.utterance: My mom would not do that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You are a young woman. Right, but remember this is for her son--

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Yes, but I think it's cute.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's really troubling.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Maybe she's just old fashioned, she doesn't want to be lonely.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, you know what, it's not going to help his street cred in getting dates, all right?

utterances.utterance: I think it's weird.

utterances.utterance: Oh wow.

utterances.utterance: What was number one?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh look at the Arby's, they have the greatest Curly Fries.

utterances.utterance: That's pretty good, that's pretty good.

utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.utterance: All right, I got another one, Marie Kondo Effect leads to uptick in national donations. Peter is like, I will never watch another episode of that ever. utterances.utterance: Yes, and you know what, you are 16, your happiness falls off a cliff, it goes down until you reach age 50. Then you get happier until you reach age 70, and I think then health becomes--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Maybe matchmaking service.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: --but you know what, here's the key. The keys to happiness, health, marriage, house, education, and the happiest people, the clergies number one, pro athlete number two, air traffic controllers number three, and here's the crazy part--

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: --politicians number four.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They are liars.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay, that's fake news maybe.

utterances.utterance: All right, One More Thing is up next.

utterances.utterance: No chance for her. One More Thing, Jesse?

Please bring back Dana; you have lost the balance. Oh this is in all caps, stop yelling at Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh thank you, mom. Thank you, mom.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And you must stop being Trump mouthpiece. Do not name call and parrot Trump's insults, that is beneath you. It's actually not. And finally, one positive, your tie knot looks better and you are buttoning your top button. There you go, mom. Martha MacCallum tonight Wednesdays with Watters.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, Juan?

utterances.utterance: Talk about inspiring, here's as NFL linebacker Shaquem Griffin at the Brooks Rehabilitation Center in Jacksonville, Florida. Griffin is missing his left hand meets a little guy who also has a disabled limb. Take a look.

utterances.utterance: Hey.

There's also, I tell you what podcast, we just recorded it today.

utterances.utterance: All right, go to foxnewspodcast.com, I got my new one up there with Howie Kurtz, he is electrifying, check it out, I tweeted it. Now it is time for this.
